entries.content: When a prospect reacts negatively to a topic (like recruitment calls), ask clarifying questions to understand the root cause of their frustration.
entries.notes: Used after a provocative opener to uncover the 'why' behind the objection.

entries.content: If I told you that this call was about [topic the prospect dislikes], would a little piece of you die?
entries.notes: Provocative opener designed to elicit an honest, potentially negative, reaction that can then be explored.

entries.content: Well look, before you hang up, can I ask a question? Why does everybody say that?
entries.notes: Follow-up question to the provocative opener, aiming to get the prospect to vent and reveal the root cause of their objection.

entries.content: Listen actively when a prospect vents about their frustrations; this provides valuable insight into the root cause of their objections.
entries.notes: Allowing the prospect to 'vent' helps build rapport and reveals pain points/reasons for resistance.

entries.content: Is there any particular reason why?
entries.notes: A direct clarifying question used when a prospect says 'no' to understand the specific reason.

entries.content: Always go in with a question; you don't know which question will prompt the prospect to speak and reveal their underlying reasons.
entries.notes: Emphasizes the importance of questions in uncovering objections and their roots.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
